Posts.Content: Mar 26, 2008 07:17AM CCookie wrote: Thanks everyone.  I go to the surgeon tomorrow.  I'm nervous but can't wait to get more information.  I have read a lot since last week and some things make me feel better and some make me feel worse.  I'm havin issues at work as well because last week when I had the biopsy I told my boss not thinking that she would tell everyone in the office.  I thought my medical would be between her and I.  Well anyway I had decided not to tell my kids because I didn't want them to worry until I know that there is something to worry about.  Well my daughter did not know I was not at work the day of the biopsy and she had stopped by to see me and one of the ladies in the office took it upon herself to tell my daughter where I was and what was going on.   I am so mad at these people.  And the lady that told my daughter does not even have the decency to apologize.
Posts.Title: steriotactic biopsy results CCookie brst26

Posts.Content: CCookie wrote: I had the steriotactic biopsy Wednesday and the doctor called me today and said it's "High Risk Pre Cancerous" and she and my family doctor agree that I should have the cluster removed.  I see a surgeon next week.  I can't believe this and don't really understand this I just can't believe this is happening.  Any information anyone can give me would be appreciated.  Thank you! Posts.Content: Mar 28, 2008 12:16PM CCookie wrote: Thanks for everyones kind words.  Sometimes it's just nice to talk to other's that are going through the same thing.  I went to the surgeon yesterday.  It's LCIS.  I am having surgery April 11th.  They are also going to do a biopsy on my lymph nodes in my armpit to make sure there is nothing there.  The surgeon made it sound like it was no big deal and everything should be fine.  But he did say it could happen to the other breast.  I hope not!
Posts.Title: steriotactic biopsy results CCookie brst26

Posts.Content: Mar 31, 2008 12:11PM CCookie wrote: I am calling the Dr's office today.  He is injecting dye first so maybe he said he is doing that to see if anything shows up and if it does he is doing the lymph node biopsy.  But I thought what he was telling me was he IS doing it.  My mom went with me and I asked her we even took notes and she can't remember how he put it either.  This is all stressfull and confusing.  I'm glad someone brought this to my attention because I had no idea.  You all have been very helpful!  Thank you!
